items.prTitle: Mark SRE build as BG-granted when a grant is completed
items.body:
This works, and I know that it's very tempting to do so... but this is a bad practice in software (Tight coupling / layering violation). Basically, you are tying a database call with external side effects (changes non-atomic, harder to test, etc)

The easiest fix will be to move this to the route handler that it's using the "reviewGrant" function. Routes handlers can be seen as the "orchestration layers" so they can call different parts of the system.
items.author: carletex

items.prTitle: Mark SRE build as BG-granted when a grant is completed
items.body:
We'd have to check if this can be a problem in Vercel (same as if we in https://github.com/BuidlGuidl/grants.buidlguidl.com/pull/150/files#r2272681391)

Because the request might be aborted if the Vercel function finished. In SRE, we use the "waitUntil" thing for async stuff.
items.author: carletex

items.body:

Approving, but letting the merge to you (in case you have to configure Vercel env vars or something before)

items.prTitle: Fetch builders and user roles data from SRE
items.body:
For the future. We could have the proper type for the return from SRE

```
  userAddress: '',
  role: '',
  createdAt: '',
  updatedAt: ',
  ens: '',
  ensAvatar: '',
  socialTelegram: '',
  socialX: '',
  socialGithub: '',
  socialInstagram: '',
  socialDiscord: '',
  socialEmail: '',
  socialFarcaster: ',
  location: '',
  batchId: '',
  batchStatus: '',
  referrer: '',
  originalUtmParams: ''
```

and use it in the app (instead of remapping some stuff in `fetchBuilderData`)
items.author: carletex

items.prTitle: Fetch builders and user roles data from SRE

Let's keep an eye on and see if everything works as expected on the live site.
